title: Vinnie Jones eyeing up Britain’s Got Talent judging role after X Factor success
text:
Could Vinnie be joining the BGT line up? (Picture: ITV)

Vinnie Jones has set his sights on a spot on the Britain’s Got Talent judging panel to honour his late wife Tanya.

The 54-year-old actor and former footballer sadly lost his wife of 25 years in July after a six year long battle with cancer and has been competing on The X Factor: Celebrity in her honour.

But looking to the future, Vinnie revealed that while he’s loving competing in the singing competition, he really wants to have a go at judging too.

‘Tanya was always a good judge. She would always have her favourite,’ Vinnie told the Daily Star.

‘I might be a contestant now, but I would also love to be considered to be a judge somewhere on one of Simon [Cowell’s] shows.

‘Either Britain’s Got Talent or America’s Got Talent because there is so much variety.’

Vinnie’s impressed X Factor fans with his charm and vocal ability (Picture: Rex)

In the father-of-two’s opinion, Simon’s talent juggernaut is missing a straight-talking, no-nonsense judge.

Unsurprisingly, Vinnie thinks he can fill that position.

‘Piers Morgan did a great job because he told it how it was,’ he continued, ‘Simon used to but he’s gone soft in his old age and especially as there’s no Piers.

‘And Mel B… she’d say it how it was on America’s Got Talent. She’s gone from that show now, too.

‘So the Vinster is waiting. The Vinster is there for either show.’

Speak it into existence, eh Vinnie?

However, while the former professional footballer isn’t a huge fan of his X Factor: Celebrity co-star Simon’s judging style, Vinnie admitted that Tanya had always had a soft spot for the TV mogul.

‘In the early days, I would give Simon a bit of stick and Tanya would stick up for him,’ he said. ‘She loved him.’
